children.name: We use cookies on our website to give you the most relevant experience by remembering your preferences and repeat visits. By clicking “Accept All”, you consent to the use of all the cookies. However, you may visit "Cookie Settings" to provide a controlled consent.

This website uses cookies to improve your experience while you navigate through the website. Out of these, the cookies that are categorized as necessary are stored on your browser as they are essential for the working of basic functionalities of the website. We also use third-party cookies that help us analyze and understand how you use this website. These cookies will be stored in your browser only with your consent. You also have the option to opt-out of these cookies. But opting out of some of these cookies may affect your browsing experience.
Necessary cookies are absolutely essential for the website to function properly. These cookies ensure basic functionalities and security features of the website, anonymously.
• Description The cookie is set by the GDPR Cookie Consent plugin and is used to store whether or not user has consented to the use of cookies. It does not store any personal data.
The cookie is set by the GDPR Cookie Consent plugin and is used to store whether or not user has consented to the use of cookies. It does not store any personal data.
• Description This cookie is set by GDPR Cookie Consent plugin. The cookies is used to store the user consent for the cookies in the category "Necessary".

• Description CookieYes sets this cookie to remember users' consent preferences so that their preferences are respected on subsequent visits to this site. It does not collect or store any personal information about the site visitors.

CookieYes sets this cookie to remember users' consent preferences so that their preferences are respected on subsequent visits to this site. It does not collect or store any personal information about the site visitors.

• Description Calendly sets this cookie to track users across sessions to optimize user experience by maintaining session consistency and providing personalized services

Functional cookies help to perform certain functionalities like sharing the content of the website on social media platforms, collect feedbacks, and other third-party features.
• Description Linkedin set this cookie for storing visitor's consent regarding using cookies for non-essential purposes.

• Description LinkedIn sets the lidc cookie to facilitate data center selection.

• Description YouTube sets this cookie to store the user's video preferences using embedded YouTube videos.
YouTube sets this cookie to store the user's video preferences using embedded YouTube videos.

• Description The cookie ytidb::LAST_RESULT_ENTRY_KEY is used by YouTube to store the last search result entry that was clicked by the user. This information is used to improve the user experience by providing more relevant search results in the future.

The cookie ytidb::LAST_RESULT_ENTRY_KEY is used by YouTube to store the last search result entry that was clicked by the user. This information is used to improve the user experience by providing more relevant search results in the future.
• Description The yt-player-headers-readable cookie is used by YouTube to store user preferences related to video playback and interface, enhancing the user's viewing experience.
The yt-player-headers-readable cookie is used by YouTube to store user preferences related to video playback and interface, enhancing the user's viewing experience.
• Description YouTube sets this cookie to store the user's video preferences using embedded YouTube videos.
YouTube sets this cookie to store the user's video preferences using embedded YouTube videos.
• Description The yt-player-bandwidth cookie is used to store the user's video player preferences and settings, particularly related to bandwidth and streaming quality on YouTube.
The yt-player-bandwidth cookie is used to store the user's video player preferences and settings, particularly related to bandwidth and streaming quality on YouTube.
• Description The yt-remote-cast-installed cookie is used to store the user's video player preferences using embedded YouTube video.
The yt-remote-cast-installed cookie is used to store the user's video player preferences using embedded YouTube video.
• Description The yt-remote-session-app cookie is used by YouTube to store user preferences and information about the interface of the embedded YouTube video player.
The yt-remote-session-app cookie is used by YouTube to store user preferences and information about the interface of the embedded YouTube video player.
• Description The yt-remote-session-name cookie is used by YouTube to store the user's video player preferences using embedded YouTube video.
The yt-remote-session-name cookie is used by YouTube to store the user's video player preferences using embedded YouTube video.
• Description The yt-remote-fast-check-period cookie is used by YouTube to store the user's video player preferences for embedded YouTube videos.
The yt-remote-fast-check-period cookie is used by YouTube to store the user's video player preferences for embedded YouTube videos.
Analytical cookies are used to understand how visitors interact with the website. These cookies help provide information on metrics the number of visitors, bounce rate, traffic source, etc.
• Description Amplitude sets this cookie, which is used to uniquely identify the user's machine.
Amplitude sets this cookie, which is used to uniquely identify the user's machine.

• Description Google Analytics sets this cookie to calculate visitor, session and campaign data and track site usage for the site's analytics report. The cookie stores information anonymously and assigns a randomly generated number to recognise unique visitors.

Google Analytics sets this cookie to calculate visitor, session and campaign data and track site usage for the site's analytics report. The cookie stores information anonymously and assigns a randomly generated number to recognise unique visitors.

• Description Google Analytics sets this cookie to store information on how visitors use a website while also creating an analytics report of the website's performance. Some of the collected data includes the number of visitors, their source, and the pages they visit anonymously.

Google Analytics sets this cookie to store information on how visitors use a website while also creating an analytics report of the website's performance. Some of the collected data includes the number of visitors, their source, and the pages they visit anonymously.
• Description Hotjar sets this cookie to ensure data from subsequent visits to the same site is attributed to the same user ID, which persists in the Hotjar User ID, which is unique to that site.
Hotjar sets this cookie to ensure data from subsequent visits to the same site is attributed to the same user ID, which persists in the Hotjar User ID, which is unique to that site.
• Description Hotjar sets this cookie to ensure data from subsequent visits to the same site is attributed to the same user ID, which persists in the Hotjar User ID, which is unique to that site.

• Description Google Tag Manager sets the cookie to experiment advertisement efficiency of websites using their services.
Google Tag Manager sets the cookie to experiment advertisement efficiency of websites using their services.
• Description Google Analytics sets this cookie to store and count page views.
Google Analytics sets this cookie to store and count page views.
• Description Amplitude sets this cookie, which is used to uniquely identify the user's machine.
Amplitude sets this cookie, which is used to uniquely identify the user's machine.
Performance cookies are used to understand and analyze the key performance indexes of the website which helps in delivering a better user experience for the visitors.
• Description Google Universal Analytics sets this cookie to restrain request rate and thus limit data collection on high-traffic sites.
Google Universal Analytics sets this cookie to restrain request rate and thus limit data collection on high-traffic sites.
Advertisement cookies are used to provide visitors with relevant ads and marketing campaigns. These cookies track visitors across websites and collect information to provide customized ads.
• Description LinkedIn sets this cookie from LinkedIn share buttons and ad tags to recognize browser IDs.
LinkedIn sets this cookie from LinkedIn share buttons and ad tags to recognize browser IDs.

doubleclick.net sets this cookie to determine if the user's browser supports cookies.
• Description Google DoubleClick IDE cookies store information about how the user uses the website to present them with relevant ads according to the user profile.
Google DoubleClick IDE cookies store information about how the user uses the website to present them with relevant ads according to the user profile.
• Description Youtube sets this cookie to track the views of embedded videos on Youtube pages.
Youtube sets this cookie to track the views of embedded videos on Youtube pages.
• Description YouTube sets this cookie to measure bandwidth, determining whether the user gets the new or old player interface.
YouTube sets this cookie to measure bandwidth, determining whether the user gets the new or old player interface.
• Description YouTube sets this cookie to store the user's cookie consent state for the current domain.
YouTube sets this cookie to store the user's cookie consent state for the current domain.
• Description YouTube sets this cookie to register a unique ID to store data on what videos from YouTube the user has seen.
YouTube sets this cookie to register a unique ID to store data on what videos from YouTube the user has seen.
• Description YouTube sets this cookie to register a unique ID to store data on what videos from YouTube the user has seen.

In case of a technical accident, BABELE will communicate to the client’s counterpart the nature of the issue and the activities required to ensure the timely recovery of the systems or assets involved. Three types of priority are established for the application service level agreement, detailed below:

• “Critic priority” includes the total and partial unavailability of a critical application or service; and extreme slowness that causes a drop in performance. The recovery time is 8-16 hours, which includes the identification and resolution of the issue, the recovery of the latest available backup data and the testing of the system before restoring the platform.

“Critic priority” includes the total and partial unavailability of a critical application or service; and extreme slowness that causes a drop in performance. The recovery time is 8-16 hours, which includes the identification and resolution of the issue, the recovery of the latest available backup data and the testing of the system before restoring the platform.
• “Serious priority” involves loss of non-transactional services. The recovery is of 2-3 working days.
“Serious priority” involves loss of non-transactional services. The recovery is of 2-3 working days.
• “Low priority” involves none of the previous two. The recovery time coincides with the release of the next development sprint (which takes place every 2 weeks).
“Low priority” involves none of the previous two. The recovery time coincides with the release of the next development sprint (which takes place every 2 weeks).

When you upload materials on the Website, you agree and warrant that you hold all Intellectual Property Rights or you have obtained a license, the required rights, the consent or any valid approval according to the applicable law to use, reproduce, share, public communicate and disclose on Internet the respective materials.

Babele is not liable, does not allow and does not support in any manner users activity on the Website that may infringe on any third party Intellectual Property Rights. Babele will remove from the Website any content or material where a third party notifies that a certain material breaches the Intellectual Property Rights.

Thus, if you are the owner of an Intellectual Property Right and you consider that any of the materials posted by the users infringes your right, you may send a notice to us, to include the following information:
• Precise identification of the content or material posted on the Website that you consider to infringe your Intellectual Property Rights and that you wish to be removed from the Website;
Precise identification of the content or material posted on the Website that you consider to infringe your Intellectual Property Rights and that you wish to be removed from the Website;

Relevant proof to emphasize that you are entitled to act as owner of the Intellectual Property Rights over the content/material;

Correct and complete information necessary for Babele to contact you: name, phone number, e-mail, address;
• The signature of the Intellectual Property owner or of the person authorized to act on behalf of the owner;
The signature of the Intellectual Property owner or of the person authorized to act on behalf of the owner;

Also, Babele will prohibit the access of users that usually infringe the present Terms and Conditions, being entitled to definitely close the accounts of these users. There is a repeated breach when user has been warned for minimum two times and/or the content posted was removed for minimum two times from the Website because infringing on the Website Terms and Conditions.
We are committed to ensuring that your privacy is protected and we comply with the comply with the General Data Protection Regulation ((EU) 2016/679) (“GDPR”)

This privacy policy sets out how we collect personal information from you and how the personal information you provide will be processed by us. By signing up for the usage of the Website you are accepting and consenting to the practices described in this privacy policy. If you do not consent, please do not submit any personal data to us.
Babele’s use and transfer to any other app of information received from Google APIs will adhere to
Google API Services User Data Policy
Google API Services User Data Policy
8.1  What information do we hold and how will we use it?
We may collect and process the following data about you:

◦ Account information: This includes data such as email addresses, usernames, and passwords used for user registration and authentication, ◦ Profile Information: This includes information provided by users to create their profiles, such as names, country, bio, industry expertise, market expertise, skills and competences; ◦ Activity Data: This refers to information about the users’ interactions with the platform, such as the number of accesses, last login date, followed users, followers, comments, emitted likes, received likes, session notes, assigned requests; ◦ Program Data: This includes information related to the programs hosted in the platform, such as program name, curriculum, application forms, companies description, Session notes , CSAT (5 stars) + comment.

We will retain your IP Address (as through GCP Cloud Logging it’s not possible to delete log records using the API) and we will retain your personal data in backups, for a maximum of 10 days (e.g. after 10 days the back-ups are deleted).

We will retain your IP Address (as through GCP Cloud Logging it’s not possible to delete log records using the API) and we will retain your personal data in backups, for a maximum of 10 days (e.g. after 10 days the back-ups are deleted).
8.2  Use made of the data and legal basis

• We process personal information if the processing is necessary to fulfill our obligations under any contract we have entered into with you or with the organization of the program you are part of, especially as it pertains to the services which are provided to you via the platform (Article 6(1)(b) GDPR).We process personal information to send you newsletters and email notifications of your activity in the platform, if you have consented to us doing so (Article 6(1)(a) GDPR). We process personal information for certain legitimate business purposes (according to Article 6 (1) (f) GDPR), which include some or all of the following: ◦ Where the processing enables us to enhance, modify, personalise or otherwise improve the Website, our services and communications for the benefit of our customers; ◦ to identify and prevent fraud; ◦ to enhance the security of our network and information systems; ◦ to better understand how people interact with our websites; ◦ to administer the Website and carry out data analysis, troubleshooting and testing. We may use the information we receive and/or collect about you, on the basis of legitimate interest according to Article 6 (1) (f) GDPR, in order to provide general statistics of the usage of the community you are part of to the program administrator to monitor the effectiveness of the program. These statistics include: ◦ Name ◦ Email address ◦ Country ◦ Registration date ◦ Last Login date ◦ # of accesses ◦ are you part of a project team ◦ list of owned projects ◦ list of followed projects ◦ # Followed Users ◦ # Followers ◦ # Comments ◦ # Likes received ◦ # Likes given Statistics regarding projects you may have developed within the program include: ◦ Name ◦ Country ◦ Category/sector ◦ Development Stage ◦ Creation Date ◦ Total # Users ◦ Team Members ◦ Followers ◦ # of Views ◦ # Assignments completed ◦ # Comments received ◦ # Discussions created ◦ Last Update ◦ Total # Updates

• Ensure that statutory, regulatory and contractual obligations are constantly met; and that access to information is solely granted for justified business needs. In this respect, the cryptographic protocol Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) is used to ensure privacy from eavesdropping on public and non-BABELE networks. The data hosting is performed through Google Cloud Services, which meets a broad set of international and industry-specific compliance standards, such as ISO 27001, HIPAA, FedRAMP, SOC 1 and SOC 2.

We use Hotjar, Amplitude, and Google Analytics in order to better understand our users’ needs and to optimize our service and experience. These techologies help us better understand our users’ experience (e.g. how much time they spend on which pages, which links they choose to click, what users do and don’t like, etc.) and this enables us to build and maintain our service with user feedback. Hotjar, Amplitude, and Google analytics use cookies and other technologies to collect data on users’ behavior and their devices. This includes a device’s IP address (processed during your session and stored in a de-identified form), device screen size, device type (unique device identifiers), browser information, geographic location (country only), and the preferred language used to display our website. Hotjar, Amplitude, and Google Analytics store this information on our behalf in a pseudonymized user profile. All these services are contractually forbidden to sell any of the data collected on our behalf. You can control the use of cookies at the individual browser level. To provide website visitors more choice on how their data is collected by Google Analytics, Google has developed an Opt-out Browser add-on, which is available by visiting
, to enable you to opt-out of Google’s programs.
BABELE commits to back-up all data arising from the operation of the Platform Service on a weekly basis, and to retain the last ten (10) backups.

You may delete your account at your sole discretion. When you delete your account, we will stop displaying your User Posts (other than Public User Posts, which may remain fully available) to other users, but it may not be possible to completely delete that content from our records and that your User Posts may remain viewable elsewhere to the extent that they were copied or stored by other users.
We are also free to close your account for any reason, including but not limited to the breach of these Terms and Conditions.
User data will also be destroyed in case, at the end of the term of a service agreement, the client decides not to renew the service usage.
